Welcome to hw_fastapi’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to confirm

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶
The create function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object to be created. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Validate the body of the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_guest(body: GuestModel, db: Session)¶

The create_guest function creates a new guest in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – GuestModel: Pass the data from the request body into this function

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

A tuple containing the new guest object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_id(user_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_user_by_id function takes in a user_id and db Session object, and returns the User object with that id. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_users(db: Session)¶

The get_users function returns a list of all users in the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.remove(user_id: int, db: Session)¶
The remove function removes a user from the database.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the user to remove. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user id of the user to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update(user_id: int, body: UserModel, db: Session)¶
The update function updates a user in the database.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the user to update. body (UserModel): The updated version of the UserModel object.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Identify the user to be deleted

  • body – UserModel: Get the user’s email from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → Type[User] | None¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the update was successful

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object

  • refresh_token – Update the refresh_token in the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Find¶

async src.repository.find.get_birthday_list(shift: int, db: Session)¶

The get_birthday_list function takes in a shift value and a database connection. It then returns all contacts whose birthday is within the next ‘shift’ days.

Parameters:

  • shift – int: Set the range of days in which to look for birthdays

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.find.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email address and a database session. It then queries the database for a user with that email address, returning the first result if it exists.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user we want to get

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.find.get_user_by_firstname(firstname: str, db: Session)¶
The get_user_by_firstname function returns a user by firstname.
Args:

firstname (str): The name of the user to find.

Parameters:

  • firstname – str: Define the type of parameter that will be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first contact in the database whose firstname matches the given name

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.find.get_user_by_lastname(lastname: str, db: Session)¶

The get_user_by_lastname function takes a lastname and returns the user with that lastname.

Parameters:

  • lastname – str: Specify the lastname of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user with the given lastname

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.find.get_user_by_phone(phone: str, db: Session)¶
The get_user_by_phone function takes a phone number and returns the user associated with that phone number.
Args:

phone (str): The user’s phone number. db (Session): A database session object to query for the user.

Parameters:

  • phone – str: Pass the phone number of the user to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

REST API routes Find¶

async src.routes.find.get_birthday_list(shift: int = Query(0), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_birthday_list function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days. The shift parameter allows you to specify how many days ahead or behind you want to look for birthdays. For example, if shift is set to 1, then it will return all contacts with birthdays tomorrow.

Parameters:

  • shift – int: Determine the shift of birthdays to be returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts who have a birthday in the next 30 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.find.get_user_by_search_parameter(search_param: str, value: str, db: Session, current_user: User) → UserResponse | None¶
async src.routes.find.search_contact(search_param: str, value: str = Query(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contact function searches for a contact by either their username or email.

The search_param parameter is the field to be searched, and value is the value of that field. If no user with that username or email exists, an HTTP 404 error will be returned.

Parameters:

  • search_param – str: Specify the search parameter (e

  • value – str: Specify the value of the search parameter

  • min_length – Specify the minimum length of the value parameter

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.get_user(user_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_user function is a GET request that returns the user with the given ID. If no such user exists, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the type of parameter that is expected

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

The get_users function returns a list of users.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.remove_user(user_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_user function removes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the path parameter in the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The removed user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_user(body: UserModel, user_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_user function updates a user in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns a UserModel object.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A usermodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Guest¶

async src.routes.guest.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the user object from the database

Returns:

The current user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.guest.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

The function takes in two arguments: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary that contains all of the information about the user, such as their username, email address, etc. Expires_delta is an optional argument that specifies how long you want your access token to be valid for (in seconds). If no value is specified then it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the access token

Returns:

The encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s email address

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email address and a timestamp

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which is 7 days in seconds.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time of expiration for the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded using the jwt library

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that was sent by the client

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserRouter class. It takes in a token and db session, and returns the user object associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an error.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes and methods

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If so, it returns the email address from the payload’s sub field. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot;. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT, we raise another HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocess

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email address of a user

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A string of characters that represents the hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that it can be called on an instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that the user entered into the form

  • hashed_password – Compare the plain_password parameter to the hashed password stored in the database

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

REST API service Cloudinary¶

class src.services.cloudinary.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

static generate_name_avatar(email: str)¶

The generate_name_avatar function takes an email address as input and returns a string that is the name of the avatar image. The function uses SHA256 to hash the email address, then truncates it to 12 characters. It then prepends ‘web9/’ to this string and returns it.

Parameters:

email – str: Define the type of parameter that is expected

Returns:

A string that is the name of a file in the web9 directory

Doc-author:

Trelent

static get_url_for_avatar(public_id, r)¶

The get_url_for_avatar function takes in a public_id and an r (which is the result of a cloudinary.api.resource call) and returns the URL for that avatar image, which will be used to display it on the page.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Specify the image to be used

  • r – Pass in the request object to the function

Returns:

The url of the avatar image

Doc-author:

Trelent

static upload(file, public_id: str)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. The function then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided. If no public_id is provided, one will be generated automatically.

Parameters:

  • file – Pass the file to be uploaded

  • public_id – str: Specify the public id of the uploaded image

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent
